column4: for the ubuntu 10.04 liveCD, how do I change the boot options?
liveCD won't start though, I need to set some VGA options or something, I need to make sure I can get to something into which I can change parameter
I tried pressing F6
for instance, I cannot get to the screen as detailed here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BootParameters
I _do_ get a screen that shows a keyboard and a little man
but then it blacks out
do you know what graphics chip you have? (or computer model?)
it's an ATI HD 3***
you get the grub screen by hitting escape as soon as the little man shows. Then F6 and then escape again give you grub line. You could try "xforcevesa" "xdriver=vesa" or "noapic" options
will try that
removed silent and splash options, and liveCD hangs on "Console: switching to colour frame buffer device 210x65"
i'm trying to find and option for you
maybe "uvesafb" option? i'm having trouble finding options list. is this a notebook with an external graphics port (if so graphics might be switching to that)
this is a desktop, the original nvidia card died on me, I'm borrowing an ATI card to try and see if it's just a video card problem
I think there may be other problems too.
does this computer also have integrated graphic?
no it does not
trying "uvesafb" option
I suspect my motherboard may now be faulty
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-ati/+bug/560306 suggests trying 'nomodeset' and 'radeon.modeset=0' or trying other DVI video port if your card has two.

ah just saw that. you are a step ahead of me. The solution also recommends using that workaround and then installing proprietary drivers for a system install. (if you were planning to do system install)
yeah it worked, I need to figure out how to repair my installation now :P
